1. City Council
  2. R.E. Spradlin III

R.E. Spradlin III

Term: 2 Years

Born to Betty and Ronald E. (Sonny) Spradlin, Ronnie's parents brought him home to a 3 room apartment over East Texas Lumber, the business founded in 1934 by his grandfather, R. E. Shiplap Spradlin, Sr. Mayor Spradlin is a lifetime resident of Kilgore and during college was a manager for the Kilgore College Rangerettes and traveled with the group to Hong Kong. Eventually, he became assistant manager at East Texas Lumber in 1979 and then manager in 1983. Finally, he became sole owner of the company in 2001 where he ran it for 21 years. Ronnie sold East Texas Lumber in 2022 and is happily retired.

Ronnie Spradlin attended Kilgore Schools before going to Kilgore College. He then went on to receive a Finance degree from the University of Texas at Tyler.

  • Member at First Presbyterian Church of Kilgore, Deacon
  • Kilgore Historical Preservation Foundation, Co-founder & President 3 years
  • Kilgore Chamber of Commerce, board member 6 year & President
  • Texas Shakespeare Festival Guild, Co-chair 2 years
  • Glory Days Festival, Co-chair 2 years
  • Roy H Laird Hospital Board, member
  • Kilgore Main Street Board, member
  • Kilgore Improvement and Beautification, board member
  • Kilgore Industrial Foundation, board member
  • Gregg County Appraisal District, Appraisal Review Board member
  • Texas Lumberman's Association, executive board member
  • Project Graduation, volunteered over 35 years
  • After Prom Volunteer 10+ years
  • Kilgore National Bank, Board member
  • Hearts Anonymous, Co-founder & Board member
  • Kilgore Community Development Corporation, President
  • Kilgore City Council, Councilman 4 years, Mayor 15 years
  • Kilgore Citizen of the Year, 1990
  • University of Tyler Distinguished Alumni, 2007
